user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_unmount:
```c
int lfs_unmount(lfs_t *lfs) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_unmount(%p)", (void*)lfs);

    err = lfs_unmount_(lfs);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_unmount -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_unmount:
static int lfs_unmount_(lfs_t *lfs) {
    return lfs_deinit(lfs);
}
...
static int lfs_deinit(lfs_t *lfs) {
    // free allocated memory
    if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->rcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->prog_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->pcache.buffer);
    }

    if (!lfs->cfg->lookahead_buffer) {
        lfs_free(lfs->lookahead.buffer);
    }

    return 0;
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected all provided code fragments: lfs_unmount, lfs_unmount_, and lfs_deinit. None of these contain any call to memcmp, nor do they perform comparisons of null-terminated strings using memcmp. The operations present are: locking/unlocking via LFS_LOCK/LFS_UNLOCK, tracing via LFS_TRACE (formatted logging), a call to lfs_deinit, pointer null checks (e.g. if (!lfs->cfg->read_buffer)), and calls to lfs_free on non-string buffers. There are no comparisons of char arrays or char pointers, no uses of memcmp, and no other standard-library string-comparison functions in the supplied fragments. Therefore there are no code fragments here that require investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.
